  1. Does a much better job that expected
  2. Easily the best electric razor on the market.
  3. I've had this Norelco product for at least 2 years now. It does what it is designed to do really well---when the battery is charged. Unfortunately it just doesn't hold a charge. I read reviews warning about battery charge issues but elected to buy it anyway. But, I can confirm that battery life is a major issue. I have owned a top-of-the-line Norelco shaver years and it still holds a charge for 2 to 3 weeks and I use it every day. I don't know what the problem with this Bodygroom product is but I definately would not buy it again. (Maybe Norelco has improved the battery life since mine is 2+ years old now?)
  4. This version has a very s***ty battery that takes forever to charge and discharges within a couple minutes of use.
  5. It’s comfortable and trims very wellskin-friendly shave. Won’t pull hair and leave your sking smooth. I have not had any problems with nicks or cut while trimming sensitive areas.
  6. It worked for about 6 months, and now it doesn't hold a charge longer than 20 minutes. And I would not recommend body grooming with this..
  7. It is a good trimmer, but it will pinch your skin if not careful. If i had to buy again i would not. For the price you should not have to worry about the hazard.
  8. i love it and my wife loves me for using it.<br /><br />it keeps me baby smooth down there for her.

  10. Solid device that does the job.
  11. gets the job done that's all that needs to be said
  12. I bought this to trim leg hair when running was my only form of exercise. I now use it to trim or shave other areas of my body was well, and since buying it in 2010 I replaced the foil 2-3 times. I have used it both wet and dry, but for me dry use is more comfortable. After nearly three years of use the batteries finally gave out and I decided to try replacing them. To my surprise it was easy to take apart except the batteries are soldered in. I bought replacements and put them in, but I don't recommend this for people without experience soldering. I am still very satisfied with the product and more so after seeing the how it was put together, but there are some caveats.<br /><br />I can not give it five stars because the batteries require specialized knowledge to replace. Given the cost and being otherwise so easy to take apart I was disappointed by the soldered in batteries. Too many electronics now a days are designed to be disposable. All that being said I do still recommend this for anyone looking for a body trimmer/shaver.
  13. Love the 2-in-1 for different lengths. I bought this because lady shavers aren't that great. The screen side doesn't shave as close as I'd like but still better than any lady shaver I've purchased in the past.
  14. I purchased this item a few years ago. I am reporting on long term use. After 2 years, my unit went from 30+ minutes of battery life on a charge to 1 minute. Now it runs out of power after a few seconds. I opened it up and saw that Philips uses cheap NiMH batteries (not decent at all). Additionally, they are almost impossible to replace yourself. They soldered the contacts on REGULAR AAA NiMH batteries. So basically you have to solder contacts on NEW batteries This was a conscious choice on their behalf as it was a standard battery holder, just with custom contacts. This product is literally designed to die in a few years forcing another purchase.
  15. Anyone who has ever shaved or trimmed below the waist knows that using a blade and shaving cream can cause nicks and bleeding. Contrary to some reviews, I used this groomer and suffered no nicks or gashes. The shaver cuts close enough to cause minor razor burn on tender skin, but otherwise is very comfortable. Follow the instructions and diagrams for close comfortable trimming and shaving. The diagrams show very specific techniques for using the shaver and trimmer. I Used this groomer correctly and avoided the blood letting reported by some reviewers. I strongly recommend this product.
  16. I like how the trimmer is attached to the unit. The previous version needed a lot of changing the setup, which was a pain. I've had this for almost a year now and it is my fourth Norelco grooming product. I will definitely be back for more!
  17. Best $70 I have ever spent. At first I was a bit scared to use this, especially with previous bad experiences shaving below the neck. But this is an absolutely amazing product. Very smooth and comfortable shave. However, don't get too &#34;cocky&#34; with it like I did ;) Or you might end up scathing something you wouldn't want to lose.

  34. Ok, so I have dabbled somewhat in manscaping before, which mainly involved using Nair for Men all over my body, which worked very well even for my netherparts. However, I had to use about one 7-dollar bottle of Nair per time I got rid of my body hair, which got expensive, so I stopped manscaping altogether for years.<br /><br />Now after getting back into a fitness/hygiene craze, I have decided to start manscaping once again, I deliberated that it would be proper to get something more permanent and reusable than a bottle of Nair. So I found this guy. I bought it to originally be used mostly for my chest, but I thought I could use it all over my body if need be. I also bought some more Nair, but just for my netherparts since I didn't trust putting a razor to that area . . . not yet, at least.<br /><br />So I had originally tried using both my hair clippers and my electric razor for my face on my chest, which worked to some degree, but it either didn't get the hair down as far as I'd like, or I would have razor burn. The BodyGroom Pro left a slight amount of razor burn in the form of raised bumps that show up a little bit when I shower, but it's much more manageable than before. I don't mind it too much. The first thing I noticed that impressed me was that, unlike my hair clippers, this could go right over my nipples without nicking them. That was nice to not have to worry about that. Now I'm not going to go to town on them, but I feel comfortable not avoiding them.<br /><br />So I shave my chest, and I skip my arms and legs because I don't mind having hair on them. I also have virtually no back hair, so that was skipped as well. Now I grab the bottle of Nair, and I apply it to my netherparts, which is the last thing I needed to do for my manscaping. It started burning slightly, so I immediately washed off the stuff. I knew that wasn't a good idea. The Nair for Men I had originally used never gave me any issues when putting it on my junk even when leaving it for 15+ minutes on there. No pain was ever felt in any circumstances. This Nair was different. It was more spray-on than like a foamy, whipped type that I had used before. Note to self: get the speed cream next time, which looks similar and probably is the Nair I had originally had success with. But I digress.<br /><br />So after failing with the Nair, I decided to grow the *ahem* balls to shave them. I took it slowly, cutting down the forest first with the close shaving end, only to find out it was better to shave down most of it with the guarded side first, which brought down the hair much more quickly. Then came the hard part: getting the hair down there to a close-shave finish. I started off slowly, keeping any and all skin taught so as to not let the saggy skin down there get wedged between any blades. It took probably 15 minutes the first time, but, long story short, I ended up with a completely shaved netherworld, and it was done without drawing blood or nicking myself. That entire area was almost as close-shaved as my face. Not quite, but close. That's about all you can ask for unless you use Nair or some other chemical hair remover.<br /><br />In the end, I now trust this blade to be able to fully bring any hair on my body down to smooth skin while having a low risk of cutting myself.<br /><br />The only downside is that the way the battery works is that it should not be on the charger if it is fully charged lest it slowly kill the battery's ability to hold a charge. I think this is called \\"battery memory\\" or something like that.<br /><br />Anyhow, bye bye, Nair, hello BodyGroom Pro!

  41. Really works well , worth the price
  42. Right out of the package this shaver has a solid feel to it. It fits very nicely into its charging unit and looks sleek. But, looks aren't what make this a great shaver. You have two ends, each with their own on/off controls. It's meant for below the neck, but you can easily trim above the neck as well. It does a superb job. Not much pulling and easily maneuverable. And I very much like the way I can adjust the trimmer with what I think are a lot of settings... more than I had expected. That makes sure I don't take off too much. (Reminds me of going into a barber shop and asking for a 'light trim' and walking out as if I had just joined the Marines.) This is a sturdy, great product that does the job. You can't go wrong, above or below the neck.
  43. I wish I could say that I didn't hate it, but I do. I really do. Why, you ask? 1. Razor doesn't cut anything more than 2mm in length 2. Trimmer doesn't cut anything. Especially not hair. 3. Battery lasts about 10 minutes of usage 4. Works even worse in water 5. The stand is horrible. 6. It's oddly loud, too.
  44. Let's agree: shaving is more than an act of maintenance. Let's also agree: the ways that men groom is changing.<br /><br />Let's get down to the details. I really like the small edger on the top and bottom of the trimming area. It is good for small touch-ups, like for those small outcroppings of hair on my ear lobes. Yes, on my ear lobes! Arghhh. The holder is not so great. It looks great, but it doesn't fit in there very easily. Overall, it is not as \\"close as a blade.\\" What it is, though, is very flexible. I have a beard, and I'm able to take care of more things with this tool.<br /><br />Now that I have used it for a while, I want to add one more thing. This is a tool that will change how you shave. It is possible to make small, exact cuts with this shaver. I'm able to take care of the extras, and that's a difference maker.<br /><br />If they let me re-design this: For one, I'd make it a lot smaller. This is a very nimble device. Problem is, it is built at a large scale. Is there really a reason why the base has to be so large? All that does is undermine my ability to artfully nip and tuck at those stray hairs. There is something sporty about a short-throw gear shift. That ought to be the same with this, I think. Second thing is that I would get rid of one of the two micro trimmers. The micro trimmer is great, don't get me wrong. There is nothing like it on your average beard-trimmer. This morning, I made a 2 mm wide edge between my lip and my mustache. Imagine trying that with a standard beard trimmer. Unfortunately, it is on both sides, right next to the main screen. That makes it hard to work on trimming down stubble without grazing into your beard.<br /><br />My dad used a Remington MicroScreen, which claimed to shave as close as a blade, or your money back. I remember the report it made when he struck the edge of sink with his Remington to knock the loose hair out. It was part of a morning ritual, along with John Gambling on WOR and the percolator's steady steam. The Remington MicroScreen was solid, not fancy. The Remington reduced your beard to a bare stubble. Want to shave something besides that beard? You were out of luck. Go to a barber for that other stuff. In short, it was a razor for another era. It was for the type of man that wore a white t-shirt under his dress shirt, who polished his shoes, and who thought no one was noticing when he worked on his comb-over. The Remington neatly fit into an assortment of other men's care products: Mennen Speedstick, Prell Shampoo, and Lifebuoy soap. Ah, the past.<br /><br />Well, that has all changed, and now men need more out of their shaving system. The Philips Norelco is for that new man. This shaver does all kinds of things: It can shave your chest.It could shave your back hair. It can take hair out of those funny places that didn't use to grow hair, but now they do.<br /><br />Give this razor a chance. You know what you will get if you purchase another one of those Wal-Mart style ni-cad systems. You will get a $19 system that breaks in about 14 months. This is much better.en was solid, not fancy. The Remington reduced your beard to a bare stubble. Want to shave something besides that beard? You were out of luck. Go to a barber for that other stuff. In short, it was a razor for another era. It was for the type of man that wore a white t-shirt under his dress shirt, who polished his shoes, and who thought no one was noticing when he worked on his comb-over. The Remington neatly fit into an assortment of other men's care products: Mennen Speedstick, Prell Shampoo, and Lifebuoy soap. Ah, the past. Well, that has all changed, and now men need more out of their shaving system. The Philips Norelco is for that new man. This shaver does all kinds of things: It can shave your chest.It could shave your back hair. It can take hair out of those funny places that didn't use to grow hair, but now they do. Give this razor a chance. You know what you will get if you purchase another one of those Wal-Mart style ni-cad systems. You will get a $19 system that breaks in about 14 months. This is much better.
  45. It is the best trimmer I ever bought! I have used already three other brands over the course of 10 years. This is the best one out there.   48. I'm an 18 year old female who was looking for something to get me smooth and hairless without the irritation. My skin is sensitive, so with a standard razor, I'd get all kinds of irritation, razor burn, bumps, and ingrown hairs down there. It wasn't pretty. With this device, I'm now like a hairless baby. Seriously, this thing basically shaves as close as regular razor to the skin. Well, you can feel slight stubble if you rub the shaved area with your hand in the opposite direction of which the hair grows, but it's nothing you can see or really notice. Running my hand across the shaved area in the SAME direction of which the hair grows feels and looks smooth. CLOSE ENOUGHHHH.<br /><br /> I used the trimmer side to trim the hair short and then applied baby powder so that the foil can glide more easily, and then the shaving side shaved it clean off. My only gripe is that it may take multiple passes if you can't quite get the hairs to stand up properly so that they can get cut, but you'll get them eventually.<br /><br />WARNING: The trimmer DID cut my labia minora, WITH THE GUARD ON. Yeah, SOMEHOW it managed to slip IN BETWEEN the teeth of the trimming guard and I cut myself. I wasn't paying attention as closely as I should've, so it probably was my fault.<br /><br />Ladies, be sure to keep your thin, sensitive flower petal parts out of the way, pay attention, and you'll be fine.<br /><br />Otherwise, its great to be able to achieve the bald eagle look without the skin troubles, or even to just keep the hair short with the trimmer. Easy to clean, solid device. I'd recommend this product.

  53. After using the Panasonic ER224s for years, I wanted a new one that could be used in or out of the shower.<br />After looking for a trimmer to shave my chest and lower region in the shower, I came across the Philips BG-2040 and Remington BHT-650.<br />Before I buy any product, I like to see it up front and feel it in my hands so I know what Im getting. I went to my local stores (Best Buy, Target, Walmart, BedBathAndBeyond) and they all had the Philips BG-2040. Not one store had the Remington BHT-650. I didnt want to buy it online and then have to go through the hassle of returning it if I did not like it so I scratched that off my list.<br />After reading reviews and searching for a trimmer that would work in the shower, they all pointed me to the BG-2040.<br />I went ahead and purchased it from Amazon for $49 with S&H included.<br /><br />I received it about 2 days ago and I was able to use it today in the shower. If you use this in the shower, you will need shaving cream with warm to hot water.<br />I neglected to shave the past week because I was waiting on delivery of this item. While I was shaving my chest with the shaver part, it was a little difficult because my chest hair was about 1 inch long. I flipped the shaver to the trimmer side and I was able to trim with ease. Once I was done with the trimmer side, I flipped back to the shaver side and it shaved with no problems.<br />I started shaving the top part of the shaft with the trimmer and it went really well up until (GULP) my DAM hot water went to cold water real fast and I had nippleitis (HAHA). Anyway, this shaver/trimmer is an excellent product and does what it says. I would suggest not to let your chest hairs grow to long cause then you will have to shave with both the trimmer and shaver. If you groom yourself weekly, you should be fine.<br /><br />There are 3 things Id like to point out about the shaver.<br />1-I have not been able to read anywhere online about this, but the 5 setting trimmer end, the head actually comes off completely which I did not know and thought it was there permanantly. This is perfect because I like to use the lowest possible setting when using the trimmer. (See pics)<br />2-The charging portions is OK. Initially you have to charger the product for 10 hours. After that, the manual states that the shaver/trimmer should be used twice a year where you let it die completely where the motor stops working.<br />3-The shaver/trimmer comes with a nice charging stand. I l;ike the idea and I want to leave it plugged in when not in use, BUT the manual states that the shaver/trimmer should never be put on the charger after your using it and never leave it on for more than 24 hours. If I am gonna put the stand on my counter, then why would I want to plug my shaver in if its not gonna charge unless its dead? Seeing that the shaver only last about 50 minutes, then you would have to constantly plug the charger in.<br /><br />Pros:<br />-Strong feel to the shaver/trimmer<br />-Can be used in the bath/shower<br />-Removable trimmer head<br />-Built in trimmer head so you never have to search for the correct one<br />-Trimmer and Shaver on 1 machine<br /><br />Cons:<br />-Not able to use the shaver while plugged in<br />-Not able to leave the shaver in charger overnight (24 hours)<br /><br />Conclusion:<br />-Even thought the shaver cant be left on the charger, this is an excellent product for what it does. From the looks online, this is the best item that can be used in or out of the shower and you get the best of a trimmer and shaver in one.<br />I would recommend this to anyone.did not know and thought it was there permanantly. This is perfect because I like to use the lowest possible setting when using the trimmer. (See pics) 2-The charging portions is OK. Initially you have to charger the product for 10 hours. After that, the manual states that the shaver/trimmer should be used twice a year where you let it die completely where the motor stops working. 3-The shaver/trimmer comes with a nice charging stand. I l;ike the idea and I want to leave it plugged in when not in use, BUT the manual states that the shaver/trimmer should never be put on the charger after your using it and never leave it on for more than 24 hours. If I am gonna put the stand on my counter, then why would I want to plug my shaver in if its not gonna charge unless its dead? Seeing that the shaver only last about 50 minutes, then you would have to constantly plug the charger in. Pros: -Strong feel to the shaver/trimmer -Can be used in the bath/shower -Removable trimmer head -Built in trimmer head so you never have to search for the correct one -Trimmer and Shaver on 1 machine Cons: -Not able to use the shaver while plugged in -Not able to leave the shaver in charger overnight (24 hours) Conclusion: -Even thought the shaver cant be left on the charger, this is an excellent product for what it does. From the looks online, this is the best item that can be used in or out of the shower and you get the best of a trimmer and shaver in one. I would recommend this to anyone.

DO NOT BUY THIS GROOMER! i researched very carefully all the groomers and this one was supposed to be one of the better ones. it arrived. i read the instructions carefully. practiced removing the shaving head but as soon as I removed it, a couple of springs popped out. couldn't figure out how to put them back together. searched the web but no luck.   58. This groomer is great in that it gives you a sense of safety. Other groomers have cut my badly in areas I would have rather not have been cut, but the BG2040 is not one of those products. Is it perfect? I would say no, it has a few minor flaws that kept me from giving it a full 5 stars. The shaving foil will not get as close as you want it to, but this is in keeping with all electric shavers. It must still be given the credit that it deserves, however, as it is still the best electric shaver I have used to date even though it does not get every single hair. I have found that a good solution for this problem is to gently pinch the areas where the hair is not being removed and go over them with the shaver head. It may take a bit longer this way but you are insured a good result. Ergonomically it is not so great either, it is large and can be quite cumbersome in certain areas. It casts a large shadow so it should be used in a well lit bathroom, preferably where the light is coming in from different sides of the room or directly above. What redeems this product for me is the lack of irritation produced. I have extremely sensitive skin and honestly I thought I would wake up with razor bumps all over my nether-regions from this shaver. This was not so, in fact the skin down there is as smooth as can be and I am completely comfortable into the next day. These are just examples of extreme nit-picking from me when it comes to this product and should not deter you from buying it. I enjoy being thorough in product reviews so that others can reap the benefits and know what they are in for when it comes right down to it. I have owned multiple groomers in the past and I can tell you that this is by far the best one I have ever owned. Sure it misses a few hairs now and then but other groomers miss entire patches no matter how often you go over them.

  65. After my old trimmer finally died after many years of use, my search began for a replacement. After searching reviews and different products online and eyeing every trimmer I came across in stores on and off for a couple of months, this one came towards the top and was priced not too high.<br /><br />Before I state why it's one star in my book, I want to state my prior use. If this is your first body trimmer, you don't know if it can be better or worse for certain. I've used a variety of trimmers -- for both hair found around the head and elsewhere on the body -- for about 10 years. They range from cordless to cords, beards to top hair to pubic hair. After I joined the military I started using a trimmer. First, for touching up the sides to stay within regulations, then for the nether regions soon after.<br /><br />This has been the worst trimmer experience for me thus far. It's been my current all-around trimmer for almost a year. I've cut myself more times using this trimmer than times I've been cut using anything else, for my entire life even. I can see cutting myself without a guard on the business end, but I've even done it with the shorter hair end (the shaver end, but not the shaver itself--the pre-shave finer trimmers). I've also had it pull more on that end than other shavers. There's also a large gap in the length range going from no guard to the closest guard setting. I find this really annoying when it comes to beard length (I'm in the Guard now, so I only have to be clean shaven on average twice a month). Also, I go the extra mile sometimes and try to taper the hair length from the outer groin to my leg hair for the girlfriend. I do not, nor will I ever, shave my legs. A girlfriend did it once (as in she physically did it) and that's not happening again. Oh the things women can convince men to do. Because of the guard lengths, it hasn't made a very good versatile trimmer for keeping the sides clean and tapered for me. One reason I went with this one was because it has two different built-in trimmers. I'm on the road periodically, so being able to pack less is always welcomed. This one doesn't hack it for me.<br /><br />Now I will say, the water proof feature is nice and it's been the easiest to clean--mostly because I don't have to worry about getting something wet I shouldn't. Charging is pretty easy -- although you have to have the base to charge it (it does pack pretty well) -- and it has held a charge pretty well. The battery has held strong thus far. I don't use it every day though. Maybe once or twice a week at most.<br /><br />Overall, it's been a complete letdown. I have a cordless beard trimmer that I got when my first one started to not hold a charge well that I use for keeping the sides clean and I still use it to bridge the gaps of this one for the more \\"personal grooming\\". That intermediate one will bite sometimes without a guard, so I just use its better guard lengths. With this \\"all-in-one\\" trimmer, I now have to use two separate trimmers to get what my first one has done for many years with great success. The best was a battery powered Conair beard trimmer. Unless the current model (GMT189RGB) of the one I had has changed any, it made a great personal and beard trimmer. I couldn't cut myself if I tried with that thing--and that's without a guard. I've even cut my neck with this nonsense--a first for any trimmer I've owned. In all, I think I've own about five or six. I guess it's an OK trimmer, but it's the worst one I've owned.one was because it has two different built-in trimmers. I'm on the road periodically, so being able to pack less is always welcomed. This one doesn't hack it for me. Now I will say, the water proof feature is nice and it's been the easiest to clean--mostly because I don't have to worry about getting something wet I shouldn't. Charging is pretty easy -- although you have to have the base to charge it (it does pack pretty well) -- and it has held a charge pretty well. The battery has held strong thus far. I don't use it every day though. Maybe once or twice a week at most. Overall, it's been a complete letdown. I have a cordless beard trimmer that I got when my first one started to not hold a charge well that I use for keeping the sides clean and I still use it to bridge the gaps of this one for the more \\"personal grooming\\". That intermediate one will bite sometimes without a guard, so I just use its better guard lengths. With this \\"all-in-one\\" trimmer, I now have to use two separate trimmers to get what my first one has done for many years with great success. The best was a battery powered Conair beard trimmer. I've even cut my neck with this nonsense--a first for any trimmer I've owned. In all, I think I've own about five or six. I guess it's an OK trimmer, but it's the worst one I've owned.

I've had this for a few months and every time I used it the \\"please charge me\\" light blinks on. I could still use the razor for a duration long enough to get the job done at that time. But few weeks ago the razor just completely refused to charge itself, even when placed correctly with the electrodes touching each other. There is also no easy access to the battery so I assume it does not operate on the general AA or AAA Very flawed design for a $50 groomer.

  74. I'll dispense with the pro forma encomiums of praise for this gadget's grooming properties: they're good. Whether it's a clean shave (as close as a razor, but with much less attendant ingrown hair irritation) or a meticulous, even-haired trim, this product's one of the best on the market. But given its obvious purpose as a groomer for MEN, particularly the hirsute subgroup, it seems remarkable that the design team omitted to consider that men are no more able to shave their backs alone than fly without wings. No grooming tool for men worth its salt can be sold on the premise that shaving must be a two-person operation if the entire body is to be tended to. Accordingly, this otherwise excellent tool gets a grudging 3 stars from me, as I had to purchase an entirely different product merely to cater to my back hair.

  81. I must admit that I was hesitant to buy this product. The idea of razors in my man zones made me a little uneasy. However, it faded after I used it the first time. The coolest things about the Norelco are that it is 2 sided. You can have a smooth shave or a trim. I've put both to the test. The trimmer side is much more effective when dry (great for trimming underarms) and the shaver side is great both dry and wet. I prefer to use it in the shower. The most important lesson I learned is to really take it slow on the sensitive parts. The first go I nicked myself a few times. Other than that there have been no complaints. Oh, and it is really easy to clean. Both sides of the Norelco pop off or up (in the case of the trimmer) to allow for easy cleaning. The only downside is that if you are pretty hairy and slow going you may run out of juice before you are done. I've come close a few times.

  91. I owned the previous version of this groomer, and of course now own this one as well. My old one stopped holding a charge and the cutting heads became exposed and started to cut my skin (after about 4 years), so it was time to upgrade.<br /><br />I went ahead and purchased this model and have been using it for about 9-10 months. It works, although I would say it pulls hair out just as often as it cuts it. The previous model did this, too, but not quite as often. They did change the shape and head design slightly on this model, so it's possible it's hitting the skin differently.<br /><br />What I really like about this model is the separation between the \\"razor\\" part and the hair trimmer part. If you have more hairy areas, you can knock it down quickly and efficiently with the bottom part of this device, and then follow up with the top part to get it smooth.<br /><br />Now, is this a baby-smooth shaving experience? Heck no. It's good enough for me, but please don't expect perfectly smooth skin if you have typical \\"man hair\\" in various \\"man places\\".<br /><br />The battery life is pretty good on this model. It was pretty good on the original as well, but this new one seems to be lasting longer.<br /><br />This one seems sturdier. With the old model, the cutting head would constantly pop out of the top while I was using it. With this upgraded model, they've apparently fixed that problem.<br /><br />Another nice feature of this improved model is the hair cutting portion at the bottom. It has a built-in adjustable hair length selector. On the old model, I had three little blue pieces I had to clip on depending on my preference on hair length. Those pieces always got misplaced.<br /><br />All in all, I'd recommend this product to anyone that needs to do basic body grooming activities. It's solid.
  92. I purchased this to take care of grooming my unmentionables and the occasional buildup of neck hair in-between my every-two-week haircuts. This trimmer is absolutely perfect for these two functions. Very high quality device and I'm very pleased that I bought it. Do yourself a favor and throw down 50 bucks on this.
  93. Let me start off by saying \\"I NEVER LEAVE REVIEWS\\". This thing was just too awesome not to share. Folks, I have tried Braun, Shick, other Norelco's, 4 blade razors, 5 blade razors, straights razors, on and on and on to no avail. I was so tried of the cuts and pain. Saw this little beauty when I searched for \\"ball shavers\\" on Amazon (I was surprised that \\"ball shavers\\" actually returned results). Reviews were really good so I thought I'd give my perfect ball shave quest one more try and I'm glad I did. This thing performed beyond my wildest dreams. No cuts, no nicks, no blood, no pain (just make sure you pull the skin tight and perform on dry/clean skin). I was able to do the frank and beans, leather cheerio, upper legs, chest, arm pits, and feet within 10 minutes. I first started shaving \\"below the neck\\" while deployed to Iraq because it was the only way to prevent \\"desert rot\\". Hairy, confined areas breed bacteria which equals funk. It has always been a painful endeavor...until now. I wish they had this thing ten years ago! I registered my shaver with Norelco online and they gave me a 5 year warranty! Care instructions are clear and easy to follow. Replacement blades are only needed once a year and are cheap here on Amazon (under $12). Norelco even has a 45 day money back guarantee on this thing. BUY IT! You won't be disappointed.

It is an area of very loose skin so one would think that any product that shaves that area would cause cuts or get caught in the blade. You will NOT have that problem with this shaver.   98. you knew that was coming right? First, it looks cool. It has a very cool charger, very modern and sleek looking, if a bit larger than some of our other trimmers. If you ahve longer hair anywhere on your body, this could cause some snags and pulling. My husband used this on a small area of his chest, and it worked great, though because of the space between the teeth, I don't think the shave was as close as a handheld razor would provide, but it did the job. This worked very well on my bikini line as well, and the waterproof casing allowed me to take it into the shower. All in all, it's a body groomer/trimmer. It is a little pricier than some of the other models out there, and in reality they all have the same features, so for the price you could do worse, but for a lot less you can do just as good.

The light blinks green when charging and is a steady green when fully charged. Well, the unit never gets a steady green anymore and it fact the charging light goes off completely even when in the charger. If quickly remove it from the charger and put it back then it blinks green again to indicate it's charging.<br /><br />When I attempt to use it you can hear that there isn't a lot of juice left. An orange light also blinks when the unit is about to die and that light comes on fairly quickly even after it's been charging for hours. The unit gets no more than 3-4 minutes of use now before going dead.<br /><br />I even attempted to swap out the stock batteries with a much better brand. This fix worked but it doesn't want to charge. These days I have to swap the AAA batteries out when they go dead since I can't get the unit to charge anymore. Here's a guide if you're interested. https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/Philips+Norelco+BG2040-34+BodyGroom+7100+Battery+Replacement/27145

I typically use a razor to shave, but I've found I can actually razor shave every other day by banging out a quick shave with the foil end, if I don't have an important meeting at work.<br /><br />I was impressed right out of the box because it was easy to open, and the form fitting tray holding the unit was actually high tech molded paper, so most of the packaging was recyclable.<br /><br />If I can reach it, I can trim it cleanly and painlessly with this unit. Very good, high quality engineering on this device.

  145. I cannot recommend against this product strongly enough. The trimmer part is fine; it gets the job done, which is why I'm giving the product a two-star rating, but it's nothing special.<br /><br />The real problem here is the shaver side. Like many others who have written reviews, I chose to ignore the negative reviews that detailed horror stories of cuts, gashes, and &#34;craters&#34; left in the wake of this product. $75 dollars and a full year of intermittent (and painful) attempts later, I'm writing my review to add my warning, for what it's worth.<br /><br />I have been fortunate not to experience any gashes or &#34;craters&#34; while using this shaver. Every single time I have used it to try to shave my most sensitive area, however, I have been left bleeding and in pain. Some have claimed that the foil can catch on dry skin, causing the head to tilt and the side trimmers (which I will get to shortly) to cut the skin. While this might happen in some instances, the foil itself is actually responsible for the large majority of injuries I have sustained. Somehow, no matter whether I prep the area to be shaved by leaving it as, pulling it tight, or anywhere in between, the foil manages to create the sensation that the skin is being pinched in that area hundreds of times per second, and ultimately the friction and pinching result in cuts to my skin, blood, pain, buyer's remorse, resistance of the urge to break the product in half and burn it in occult celebration, and longing for the original Body Groom that I threw away when I bought this one (although not necessarily in that order).<br /><br />The side trimmers cause their own issues. The row of teeth that moves back and forth in order to cut the hairs is actually on the skin side, not the backside as you would expect. On my old Body Groom, for whatever reason, this was never an issue and never caused any pain. On this one, the friction that results from contact with sensitive skin hurts!<br /><br />About that old Body Groom I owned. What a great product! It had no trimmer side like the Pro does, and of course it had its own design issues, but compared to this one...well, there really is no comparison, except to say that the old one actually did what it was supposed to do. Oh, and the original Body Groom emitted only a moderate noise, just strong enough to give me confidence that it was going to get in, get the job done, and get out. When I turned the new one on, I was actually startled. The sheer volume and tone of the noise this bad boy put out should have clued me into the fact that using it would be more like trying to shave with a hedge trimmer than a razor. But back to the original...<br /><br />I could shave and trim anywhere in the target area with no cuts or abrasions, and the results were always to my liking. When I was given a Target gift card and was wondering what to get, I came across this item and thought &#34;Man, if mine works so well, the Pro version must be even better!&#34; In fact, my positive experience with the old Body Groom was why I chose to ignore the negative reviews. How I rue the day I bought this and threw the old one in the trash. It was on that day that I said goodbye to the level of grooming with which I had become accustomed because it is simply impossible to replicate the results with the Body Groom Pro.<br /><br />And a quick word on the &#34;3D Pivoting Head&#34; that they advertise. The sheer amount of force required to get this shaving head to tilt up and down, much less left and right, is going to guarantee you a very, very painful result. That is all.
  146. I bought this in February 2011. Worked well for the first couple years. I didn't use it that much, maybe once or twice a month. Recently its completely stopped holding a charge.   150. I bought this hoping that it would become my only hair shaving/trimming tool. 1) The trimmer aspect of the Bodygroom is great. The adjustable guard is good quality (stays locked in at desired length, isn't too flimsy) 2) The foil shaver aspect is decent.   158. As advertised this is a great razor for the neck down. It's waterproof so its great for shaving in the shower.
  159. This device is the best trimmer/clipper for body hair that I have ever owned. First, it's worth discussing the bottom of the device - the \\"traditional\\" trimmer or clipper part. It is unexceptional, and works fine. You can shorten hair with it. It has a nice captive adjustable plastic guard you can set the length with. Most trimmers only offer this functionality. However, with most trimmers/clippers, if you want a very close trim or near-shave, you will need to remove the plastic guards, and that's when you start being able to cut yourself. I can't tell you how many times I've nicked part of my body with a host of other products. I've never cut myself with the Philips Bodygroom system. And that's because of the other side - the top. The top of the device is a rotating head, with two short trimmers and an electric shaver foil in-between them. The trimmers on top are small, don't stick out far, and are not really designed to do an amazing job cutting all your hair off. What they do is trim very effectively, without almost any possibility of cutting yourself. This means you can just wave this thing all over your body, in many lazy passes, without having to worry about nicking or hurting yourself. If it takes many passes sometimes - who cares! It's fast, easy, and safe. Once you've trimmer hair, you use the foil in the middle to get a close shave, optionally. The foil requires a slower hand, and requires you to hold the body groom perpendicular to your hair, and move it more deliberately. In other words, tilt this thing back and forth over your body, lop off all the hair, and then shave, slowly, holding it perpendicular. That's the best way to use it. Also, the trimmers are less effective when your hair is wet. Since they're a bit sloppy and tend to miss things, you want your hairs dry and \\"perky\\" so the trimmers will lop them right off. Remember, the tradeoff is to be forced to make a couple passes - what you gain is a complete assurance thatyou won't cut yourself. The foil shaver, however, works best while wet - like anything you need to make a close shave with. What I like to do is trim all my body, quickly, a couple times while standing in the shower, then turn on the water, take a shower, and slowly use the foil to shave. It's incredibly easy, incredibly fast, and works perfectly. And the bodygroom is waterproof, so you can just leave it in the bathroom or shower and charge it every a week or two. I strongly recommend the bodygroom.
  160. I bought the BG2040 to replace my dying BG2020. I like the new dual-head design and improved ergonomics of the handle.

  179. I bought this trimmer not too long ago, been about 2 months now and I must have used it 5 to 6 times by now. When I first got it, I charged it for about 10 hours and then used it but the charge only lasted for 12 minutes or so. I thought well maybe it is because I didn't charge it long enough etc. So then I charged it for 8 hours the next time and used it and it last for about 10 minutes! I thought it was because of the time lapse between the charge and me using it, since I charged it after I used it and cleaned it after each use. So, then I charged it for 8 hours-ish, then used it right away. Guess what????! It still last about the same time, 10 minutes! Point being...It cannot hold the charge as it claims for 50 minutes after 8 hours of charging, \\"Get 50 minutes of cordless use with an 8-hour charge in the sleek store..\\" I would not but this and do not recommend you to buy it. Not just because how long it can hold a charge but because you cannot use it while its charging, since it is required to be on the charging stand. If you do not care about how long it can hold a charge, I would recommend you buy it because it is a good trimmer. I like all the other features on it. The two sided this is really handy and works well! The trimmer end, which is the adjustable, is the best part of it(without having to change the clips)!

  193. I'll start by saying that the trimmer works great; I have another trimmer and used it in various \\"areas\\" with some success, but also with some problems that I haven't had with this one. However, I've been sick of using blades for shaving for some time and wanted something that I could use quickly and easily in less time and with less mess, and sadly, I'm still searching. I can't claim to have tried numerous other electric razors (although I have tried some); what I have is (even shaving with just daily stubble, as opposed to bi-weekly or less) is that the skin gets irritated (and even cut and sometimes bleeding) before all the hairs are cut. I can go over an area once, and 98% of the hair is shaved to a satisfactory level... but that just makes the rest stand out like a sore thumb. I can go back over and over those areas, irritating my skin in the process, and still have hairs left here and there that really stand out next to closely shaven skin. On the upside I will admit this (and it's the reason I still give it three stars): out of the electric razors I've tried, this is the best one so far. The head floats in every direction, and I haven't had nearly the problems I've had with previous razors. The fact of the matter is that we're all unique, and the skin and the grain of the hair growth (in odd directions) on my face and neck simply doesn't seem to be suitable for an electric razor. Yes, I've tried dry, wet, and wet with shaving cream (at which point it makes no sense to not just use a regular blade anyway). This unit is also replacing a trimmer, and for that it does a really great job.

  202. I purchased this personal groomer after my Wahl trimmer started losing battery life. After reading a lot of reviews I felt confident this item would handle my grooming needs. Just as reference I am the type of guy that trims everything short and tight about every 3 weeks. Well this go around I put off my trimming for a couple of weeks in search of a new groomer, due to my old Wahl took about a hour and half to trim everything (dying every 5 min or so and recharge). I got in my new Philips about 5 weeks after my last trimming session. It took less than an hour to charge fully right out of the box, which is nice. Now that it was ready to use I proceeded to use the &#34;trimmer&#34; side first on the #1 guide setting to cut the hair short before switching to the &#34;shaver&#34;. I honestly tried about 5 different angles and approaches and I could not cut any hair, and would probably still be standing there trying to trim if I did not get out my old Wahl and limped it along to knock the tall hair down. The Philips guard does not help lift or guide the hair into the trimming blade rendering it totally useless, unless you have all the time in the world to groom. Once I was ready to &#34;shave&#34; the Philips actually did a really nice job (chest, stomach, the boys, butt, and back). Just beware of the angle you are holding the shaver as it will nick you, and most likely in the most sensitive area too (as it did me). Once you figure out that perfect angle it works great, nice and smooth. Its design and length allowed me to reach the middle of my back with no problems and not asking for help. So, all in all, this groomer is &#34;okay&#34; not totally useless but not perfect either. It has been about 4 days since I shaved and it seems like I will need to redo everything a little sooner than normal too looking at hair growth.

  227. Although it takes practice to get used to its multi-functional design, the Bodygroom Pro Grooming System is quite an efficient body hair shaver for the hirsute among us who want to stay nicely clipped before laying claim to Darwin's theories of evolution. At the top is the groomer, which consists of a pivoting shaving head that floats according to the contours and curves of your body no matter how contoured it may be. What makes the design unique is how it allows a comfortable shave without the risk of skin irritation. There are pre-trimmer nodes mounted on both sides of the shaver head, which allows long hair to be cut to lengths that make it easier to shave.<br /><br />On the bottom is a more intense trimmer designed to cut longer hair for refined grooming. It can be set to five different lengths depending on the shortness of your hair. There are combs and rounded blades to avoid the risk of nicks. What I appreciate most is how both the shaver foil and the trimmer are made of hypoallergenic material so as to prevent the possibility of skin irritation, allergy, or rash. Helpfully, it's waterproof which gives you the flexibility to use it in the shower, and the curved shaft between the groomer and the trimmer has a rubber grip that allows a secure hold even when the Bodygroom is wet. There is a folding stand for storage and recharging, as well as an eight-hour charge that gives you fifty minutes of continuous use. Not only does it keep you well groomed, the Bodygroom itself is easy to keep clean.
  228. It works just as well as advertised. By far the best I've used.

  231. I have been using this shaver for about 4.5 months now, and it is my go-to for all of my shaving needs. Now, I'm not one of those guys that likes to have baby-smooth skin on my whole body, and this shaver won't do that for you. You can get a very, very close shave with the pivot head, but it won't be the same as using a razor, waxing, etc.<br /><br />Even though this shaver is a body groomer and not advertised as a facial hair trimmer, I do use it to trim my beard, and it works very well. I usually use the blade guard on 1 to do this. I also take the guard off to clean up my neck before using a razor. I have very sensitive skin so getting the hairs as short as possible before using a razor helps ease the discomfort.<br /><br />This shaver is advertised as a body groomer, and body grooming is what it does best. The trimmer blade works very well on the torso, providing a close shave in just a few minutes. Now, for the more sensitive parts of the body, the 3D pivoting head is a charm. For the first time, I can really clean up the most sensitive of body parts without any discomfort, pain, etc.<br /><br />The performance and battery life are really good. I usually give it a full charge every few weeks, letting the battery run pretty low before charging. I've never had any hairs get caught within the blades or the foil. It gives a very clean shave.<br /><br />Aside from the great performance of the shaver, I commend Philips on the design. It is aesthetically pleasing and has a modern look to it, so I'm not afraid to leave it on the bathroom counter at times. The ease with which the blade guard can be installed, adjusted, removed is fantastic. And since the guard is adjustable, I don't have to worry about keeping up with several guards; there's just one, and it's alway connected to the shaver. The guard is plastic, but it seems to be of good quality, and I don't see it ever breaking.<br /><br />In summary, this is a great product, and for the price point, I don't think there's anything better out there. Give it a try, and see for yourself!
  232. You need to really work through your skin with this one. And most times, you'd have to go through the same area a couples of times to get a clean cut. NOT . . . out of a dozen or so attempts, while being VERY careful and taking my time, I ending up bleeding 9 of 12 times. The teeth on this monster rip into the sack, shaft, and anything that comes in contact with them. Shredders !!! If Philips Norelco lost the the trimmer blades or made them fully retractable this product would be GREAT. You should avoid this shaver unless you like to live dangerously and enjoy a little bloody pain every now and then !!
  240. I bought this about 9 months ago and for the first 6 months it worked, mostly. 3 months in the large trimmer stopped working and after 6 months the battery needed to be charged pretty much after every use. Oh by the way, this is the third body groomer I have purchased from Norelco (2 regulars and then this pro). Battery is a looming issue in their products. All of them were unable to hold a charge for under a year and you know, I got it, replace it every year or so. Well in that case this should cost $30 bucks and not almost $70. Don't get taken, there are plenty of other products on amazon that do this job and actually last a decent period of time.<br /><br />Additionally...might I suggest you look at the Gillette fusion beard/body trimmer...under $20 and does everything this can do...plus it runs on an actual battery.
  241. So I needed a new razor for shaving and since I was tired of buying new blades at $17 a box I thought \\"Hey why not go the electric route and save some money.\\" After seeing a few ads and reviews of this Norelco I decided to use the Amazon credit I had and give it a shot. Well what can I say about the razor other then it's a razor. After reading the instructions, since I had never used an electric razor, I decided to wait a few days to shave. Now where exactly will I be shaving since not everyone will shave the same spots. Legs, Arms, and below the belt. Now I'm not a hairy man by no means facial hair yes, every where else not so much. Since I have tattoos on the arms and legs I wanted them to show better and that's why I shave those areas. The razor has two sides a Trimmer and a Shaving Head. The trimmer works great, but is insanely sharp and it has cut/nicked my manhood on several occasions. Now I've used an electric trimmer on my manhood for a few years and have never had a trimmer cut me like this one. So proceed with caution if you go below the belt. On the legs and arms the trimmer works just fine no problems. The Shaving Head sucks, but maybe all electric shaving heads suck I don't know. This thing is always leaving patches of hair as well as it pulls the living daylights out of my legs, not so much the arms. I've actually stopped using the shaving head and gone back to my Gillette Fusion. Also since I've seen the question asked a few times the manual does state that this should not be used on your face. So in the end I'd pass on this razor and find something else.

Tonight the shaver quit working (trimmer still works fine) so I'm either going to try to dig up the receipt, see if it's still under its 2-year warranty, and maybe return it for a replacement if it is. If not, I will probably purchase another one as it is - though not without its faults / cautions - the best groomer I've used.

  257. I ordered this groomer after reading a lot of positive reviews on Amazon.<br /><br />When I received it, there was enough of a charge to give it a test drive, although the low battery indicator light was flashing about half way through.<br />I'll only be using this on the south of the border region, as I don't have chest or back hair. And it had been awhile since I had performed any grooming because I was looking for a new shaver.<br /><br />Needless to say, this thing had its work cut out for it. It performed brilliantly. I used the trimmer end first, to knock down the high stuff. I originally set it on the longest setting, as a bit of a precautionary thing. It's always a little nerve-racking when there are mechanized devices with cutting heads in that region.<br /><br />I did a once over on the highest setting. No problems, so I adjusted the trimmer to the shortest setting. Again no problems!<br />Well, I prefer a smooth shave down there, as does my wife, so I turned the trimmer end off, and switched to the razor end. It's really nice that only one end will operate at a time. It decreases the chance cutting yourself.<br /><br />Anyway, the razor shaves really close. Almost as close as a manual does. The best part? NO IRRITATION!!! NONE WHATSOEVER!!! I was amazed. Normally, after trimming and then shaving with a manual, I'd end up with some razor burn/irritation 1-2 days after. I had none at all with this groomer. It's fantastic!! It's completely \\"frank and beans\\"safe. No nicks, cuts, or gashes of any kind. I did read some reviews of other groomers that people suffered such casualties. Ouch!<br /><br />The only downside to this in my opinion is that it is a little awkward at first. It's got a slight bend in it, I assume to make it more comfortable in your hand. But, it makes it awkward when you're trying to trim/shave certain areas at certain angles. This is easily overcome though by repeated uses, and becoming more comfortable with handling the device.<br /><br />Clean-up is a breeze. The trimmer guard and head come off, as does the shaving head. You can choose to either simply brush everything clean with the included brush, or you can do a combination of brushing and rinsing under the faucet. If you rinse, just let everything air dry when you're finished. Very simple.<br /><br />I can't say how many uses you will get out of a single charge. I guess it depends on how regularly you use it. The manual does say a single 8 hour charge will last 50 minutes of operation.<br /><br />One last thing is that there is a registration card included in the packaging. You can register online, which you'll earn either an additional 6 months of warranty on the groomer, or a 15% discount on your next purchase of $100 or more at the Philips Norelco online store. I chose the extended 6 month warranty.<br /><br />One last thing. My wife saw how well of a job this does, and has been begging me to let her use it as well. I'm sure it would work equally as well for women.he shaving head. You can choose to either simply brush everything clean with the included brush, or you can do a combination of brushing and rinsing under the faucet. If you rinse, just let everything air dry when you're finished. Very simple. I can't say how many uses you will get out of a single charge. I guess it depends on how regularly you use it.   278. I have been using the original Norelco Bodygroom BG2030 for just about a year and the head finally became so loose that it was no longer usable. Rather than simply get another BG2030 I decided to spend the extra $10 and upgrade to the BG2040, which as you can see includes both the regular groomer AND a trimmer.<br /><br />The first thing you notice when you get the groomer out of the packaging is that the charging stand is rather clunky and unstable. You have to fold it a certain way to get the power supply cord in and then fold it a different way in order to get the groomer in the charging cradle. There must be a better way to design a charging stand. The first unit I ordered from Amazon simply would not charge. I returned the item to Amazon and have since received a new groomer that thankfully charges as designed.<br /><br />The groomer itself is heavier and bigger than the BG2030 and fits more comfortably into my hand when using it. The groomer portion (as opposed to the trimmer) is very similar to the prior version and if anything actually seems to be slightly less effective. I found myself going over the same area several times to achieve the desired smoothness.<br /><br />The trimmer portion is worth the $10 upgrade if you like to quickly trim your chest hair without completely shaving yourself to the point of having that annoying prickly chest for 3 days. The trimmer is surprisingly effective at getting through hairy areas and the plastic guide has 5 settings without needing to use different plastic attachments.<br /><br />Overall if you've been using the BG2030 and could use a trimmer attachment this model is worth the $10 incremental cost.

I read reviews as \\"Ouch!\\" if you remove the trimming length adjusting unit while doing delicate areas. So I did not take a chance. Did not receive a single cut anywhere. Some reviews said that the length adjusting comb feels fragile. I disagree, its well designed and easy to use. Key is to never adjust or remove/attach by holding the comb end. Use the sliding end that fits into the unit. It slides back smoothly.<br />I did not try it on face. I feel that this device is a very close-to-skin trimmer and may not/won't be as good as shaving. I will stick to my Fusion Plus for facial shaving. The battery life truly surprised me. Lasts for at least one hr. I feared I might have to recharge before I was done but it didn't give up on me. Worth all the $$ and works as good in the shower. Like another reviewer said, a must have for all hairy men. So awesome that my armpit is so smooth like I shaved with a razor. Its that close-to-skin!

  289. After buying at least a dozen groomers that I was never very satisfied with, I decided to give this a try. I liked the fact that it's just one unit and you don't have a bunch of parts separate from the unit, which makes this the best for no clutter and taking up very little room. Cons: This can only be charged while in its stand/cradle. It charges well, but the stand is too lightweight for the groomer. Therefore, I have to set it so the front leans against the wall. Otherwise it just falls over. Not a huge deal though. Compared to other trimmers, the length settings seem a bit different. The 1 seemed to trim more like a 2 compared to other trimmers. But since the quality of the trim is good, the simple adjustment isn't a huge inconvenience. Other trimmers I've tried in the past have had a tendency or nicking the skin, which can be a bit painful. This is better than any other trimmer I've tried but I still had a little bit of it, but only when set at a 0. Here's the trick I learned though; if you go very slowly, it has a tendency of giving you a bit of a nick. If you just glide at a pace just slightly faster than a slow pace, the problem is solved. Pros: Very high quality blade. I use a 0 setting on my face prior to shaving with a razor because I find I get a closer shave doing so. This really gets a close stubble which made the razor shave great (eliminated a lot of post-shave razor burn too). It's also a very smooth, effective shave when trimming hair under your arms. Glides right through with a good trim without clogging up the blade. Clean-up. Just pop the trim selector off and wipe it clean. Easy as that. Tip: When using metal, wiping it with an alcohol wipe prevents rust and wear. Water is what causes that. One unit. There are other decent trimmers out there by companies like Wahl. But they have a bunch of different trim length selectors that are separate. Thus, they take up more space and can be irritating to keep organized. This is one unit. Sure, it's longer than other units. But it has a good grip and you get used to it really quickly. Overall, this is the best unit I've tried. Don't waste money on the $15 or even $30 trimmers. You'll be throwing them away after not much use because the quality really isn't great. This gives a great, even, smooth shave and trim in one handy unit. I'll never go back to a different trimmer.

Straight down to the skin and it is so smooth it even feels like somehow it snipped the lil hair down below the skin... It's been a few days and no red rash, no bumps just smooth soft skin. It's going to be so easy to make a routine out of keeping things trimmed. Actually its more than that, its more like completely hairless-yay! This was one of the better purchases I have made in a while. I'm still amazed with the results and NO pain or discomfort of any kind! WOOT!!!

I returned it a week after trying it. Amazon honored the 30day money-back return policy and made returning it fairly easy although I did have to pay about $6 for the return shipping.   305. I bought this for the same reason many of you are looking into it: my nether regions.<br /><br />I have tried multiple electric groomers, some work great, others just slice and dice. I have done shaving, but prefer not to for a multitude of reasons (razor bumps, ingrown hairs, razor burn, cuts, etc).<br /><br />That is when I found this, trimmer/shaver combo. It was expensive but I went out on a limb and trusted reviews. I am sure glad I did. I did not manscaping for about a 1.5 - 2 weeks leading up to trying it out to see how it does.<br /><br />At first, I tried going a little to fast and was mildly disappointed. However, once I slowed down and allowed both cutting heads to do their jobs I was very satisfied. The head trims from both directions and pivots to cut in the said direction. Sometimes it takes a couple passes.However, ultimately it will leave a VERY smooth finished product that will not lead to ingrown hairs, razor bumps, burn etc. The hair grows back soft and does not cause loads of irritation like a razor would.<br /><br />A major concern of mine was getting cut by this. I have used it 3 times since buying it and have not had so much as a slight nick yet.<br /><br />Without a doubt I would recommend this to any man looking to safely, quickly and effectively manscape.

  308. This being my first electric (dry) shaver I can only compare it to the disposable razors that I've been using since I turned legal age. For shaving the face it just isn't as close as the regular razors, it's better if you wanna keep trimmed. The beard accessory is kinda flimsy, as another reviewer wrote it tends to go the the default 1 setting when held normally, this is good for people like me who like to keep short goatees, but for those that don't it could be an issue. I've not tried \\"wet\\" shaving with this & don't expect to try. It has a pretty good battery life, but what I really got it for was for shaving those \\"other\\" areas of my body. Put bluntly the caveman look went out with the caveman & I was always afraid of trying the old fashioned razor \\"down there\\" for fairly obvious reasons. I can say that I'm pleased with the results, while not \\"smooth as a babys bottom\\" it came close, & no razor burns or discomfort afterward. For first timers like me you've got to be patient with this thing, it'll get the job done but it's no where near gonna be as fast as a razor. Do I recommend this? For the face: not really (hence why I didn't give it 5 stars). For the other parts of the body: a definite yes.

  314. So recently I decided I wanted to remove all of the hair from my body from the neck down. Until now, I didn't really consider myself a hairy guy. I have no back hair, my chest hair wasn't over grown, my arms were normal compared to a lot of my friends, my legs were probably hairier than some. I've been working out recently and after starting to see some awesome results, the hair all over just wasn't complementing me. I tried using a regular razor last week, which left me with horrible razor bumps on my chest and skin below the belly, but above the family jewels. After reading the reviews here, I decided to give this a shot.<br /><br />After an hour between the shower and bath, the only thing I found this good for was just the areas I had razor bumps on and the 'starfish' area. I don't know if the rest of my hair is simply too fine for this to work with, or perhaps I wasn't doing something right. I tried lathering up with soap, I tried using shaving cream, and finally this morning I used it dry. Even going very slow with the razor required me to make 2-3 passes to get successfully trimmed up; the 'pre-trimmers' were doing a better job than the razor under the foil.<br /><br />I ended up switching back to my normal razor last night to finish up my arms and legs because I was getting neck crams, and was getting tired of sitting in water.<br /><br />I will give this product a couple of weeks to see if/how the results improve from regular use, but after my first night using it, I was not overly impressed, and if I didn't believe in second chances, this would be going back to Philips today.<br /><br />If anyone has any tips/hints/tricks, please drop me a line at matt@mattzuba.com.<br /><br />Update On 10/20/11:<br />Once my razor bumps from normal shaving cleared up and smoothed out my skin a bit, this shaver is doing better. I shave maybe once every 1 or 2 weeks, not because my hair grows slow, but because it just takes a while and I don't like spending 45 minutes in the shower often. The trimmer is quite good for taking the hair down to a good level which can then be smoothed out by the foil side. I still use a blade on the family jewels and legs and arms (a Quatro, in case anyone cares), this just doesn't do the job for me there. The foil side works well for smoothing out the pubic area, chest and 'starfish' without worry about nicks, cuts or razor bumps.taking the hair down to a good level which can then be smoothed out by the foil side.   315. At first I was a little reluctant to like this shaver but after using it for a few weeks I really have come to like.<br /><br />As you can see in the pictures and read in the product description details on one end it includes an adjustable trimmer with five different settings to trim beards, mustaches, sideburns, etc.. The blade guard is also removable for up close detail work. On the other end you get a shaving head that pivots. I have used it for various areas of body hair and have been very happy with the results. I even used it for a quick facial shave (It was an emergency) and the results weren't too bad.<br /><br />Each end has its own on/off button so there isn't any confusion. The shaver is cordless and fits slides into a nice charging stand. The shaver itself has some stainless steel coverings with some black plastic and black rubber grips. It is actually has a quite stylish and modern look to it and I don't mind having it out on the sink.<br /><br />Performance and battery life it good too. I leave it off the charging stand often and it seems like I only have to charge it up about once a week. Charger automatically shuts off when charging is complete. As I mentioned before actually hair cutting performance is good. No clogging or sticking.<br /><br />My only complaint may be that is that shape wise it is a bit long and can be a bit unwieldy at times. Now I realize this is the result of putting two shavers in one, but I am just mentioning it. Also despite the nice aesthetics and good overall quality, some of the plastic parts, especially the plastic trimmer blade guard look and feel kind of cheap, and I am always a little worried I might brake it, rendering the trimmer pretty useless. Those are my only real complaints and relative minor ones at that. Otherwise I find this to be a great product and will be happy to continue to use in the future.

But after a month - and after the time to get the item returned - the battery just quickly faded. I followed the instructions to ensure the battery would last as long as possible, but whenever I took the razor off of the charger, sure enough the red light would flash to indicate the battery was almost dead. As a result, the razor lost a lot of its shaving efficiency. So now the razor is worse than a simple razor blade. I don't know if the razor I got was just a defective one out of many good ones, but for about sixty dollars for a razor I would have rather used my money to get a decent blade instead.<br /><br />In short, the razor's design is good, but the battery is terrible. I loved this product at first, but was seriously disappointed by how quickly it died.

You just need to be careful with the end of the trimming blades when shaving your sensitive areas. Make sure you are using the center of the foil shaver to trim the hair. You'll get used to it. Even with those nicks every once in a while it's a hell of a lot better than using a manual razor to try and shave.<br /><br />I got this thing way back in 2011 and just before my warranty was up the thing wouldn't hold a charge anymore. I got brand new replacement and after another 2 years the same thing happened and it won't charge anymore. I only use it a few times a week so I would charge it maybe every 2 weeks. FYI to prolong the battery life, like with all electronics that have rechargeable batteries you're not supposed to put it in the charger after each use (if the charger is plugged in).<br /><br />Anyway second time around they didn't give me another replacement of course but they did offer me 15% off a new one. For 4 years of use, I feel like I got my moneys worth in the long run and dealt with good customer service....rock on Philips. I found a guide to replace the batteries on ifixit.com that somebody posted in the product questions above. Of course this would void my warranty if I still had one.<br /><br />I am a hairy dude..... It's great for trimming the back of your neck between haircuts. I also have sparse long back hairs and it's not too difficult to work the shaver to get your back without anyone's help. I've found it's just okay for beard trimming but I have had irritation with all electric shavers on my face. Only 1 star lost for crappy batteries....

The build quality of the unit is nice, but apparently you're not supposed to leave it on the charger 24/7, which makes it inconvenient for occasional use (i.e. I have to remember if I charged it last time, or pre-charge it before I need it, rather than just have it be a part of my permanent counter space where I know it's always ready-to-go). Ultimately, I returned it to Amazon, as it's just not powerful enough to be effective. They need to bump up the RPM's on the trimmer so that it can cut through hair without tugging.

  336. The design is enticing because it seems to have a wide range of functionality and is waterproof, but it fails at nearly every task it is designed for. Battery: I had read a number of reviews here saying the buzzer would stop holding a charge after a few weeks, but there seemed to be a lot of disagreement. Well those reviews were right, after just a few times using the buzzer it only holds a charge for about 20 mins and becomes noticeably weaker within the first 5 minutes of use. Waterproof: The waterproof thing is a gimmick, it doesn't cut wet hair very well, so using it in the shower is highly ineffective. The Trimmer: The guard on trimmer side easily falls down to the lowest setting, so I only use it on the lowest setting now, limiting its versatility significantly. The Shaver: The shaver side is very weak and requires 5+ passes to shave any area fully. This leads to irritation and really long shaves, so I've stopped using the shaver functionality as well.

  356. Where to start this is so fantastic. Like others I read a few reviews on this and a couple other models. This seemed acceptable and would get the job done.<br /><br />My first use a few minutes ago.<br /><br />Well it far exceeded my expectations.<br /><br />First of all there is the double ended design. I've seen these before where both ends run at once, ie, double drain on the battery. Not so here. This has separate on/off for each end. Easy to locate and push button.<br /><br />The feel was very comfortable in my hand, not too heavy and easy to hold with a lite grip it was well balanced. I quickly became comfortable with it.<br /><br />I first trimmed my beard and mustache. What a pleasure. It glided effortlessly through all parts doing the job quickly. My old beard trimmer while doing a good job, never was this easy to use. I did not feel any snagging and it easily followed all contours even under the chin. Did the job much quicker.<br /><br />Next I decided to test out the manscraper function. I've had the strange feeling to shave my legs and everything below the neck for some time. I've used a manual razor with some success, but it takes so long and was harsh to my skin in some areas. This was quick and much easier. I did under arms, chest, stomach, sensative areas, legs feet and toes. Areas before that were a slight problem or tricky with a mnaul razor like rough knees and under arms, this went over easily, following contours effortslessly. It was so gentle on all body parts calling it a manscraper sounds harsh but it really does the job so very gently. Going up my legs was so easy, one single pass from foot to knee where it took three or four strokes the manual way, er width of the razor. I feel it did a much better job and in at least 1/10th the time.<br /><br />This also replaces two devices, a razor and a beard trimmer, so it saves space on the counter and one less charger plugged in.<br /><br />This is by far the best of either type I have ever owned, being about my fifth one over the years.
  357. This is my first time reviewing and i am only doing it because i expected a lot from this product. The head (side) that has the shaver works fine, except that if your hair is more than 2 inches long it would hurt a bit and won't work smoothly. The other head that has the trimmer is totally useless because after using it for 3-4 minutes the charge light starts blinking. It would start going slow and stop trimming facial or body hair. This was a total disappointment for me. Nobody mentioned it in the reviews when i was buying this product. A full charge takes about 4-5 hours and still the trimmer won't work more than 3-4 minutes, however the shaver would work without a glitch. I was stupid and threw out the box and papers of the product when i bought it (because i only used the shaver and thought everything is fine). I would not recommend this product to anyone because it doesn't work as advertised. I don't know about the older model, but people are really satisfied with it. Best of luck

  367. I've been using my new shaver for the past couple of weeks and this thing is the best! If you want smooth balls without using a rash causing razor or irritating depilatory creams, this is it. The side with the adjustable fins is great for trimming down regular body hair and, contrary to the instructions, is great for trimming facial hair to that 3 o'clock shadow look if you take the guard off. The other end with the screen does the job flawlessly on the twig and berries. It's a leap of faith the first time you apply it to your junk and rake it across, but when you feel how smooth the trim is and how it does not cut or burn your tender bits, you will groom more aggressively. The tilting head really helps get the taint and ass area baby smooth, in complete comfort. As an avid manscaper, I highly recommend this product... and so do my girls who get to enjoy the results!<br /><br />Build quality is top notch and mine has been running off the original charge for 2 weeks now. Make sure to follow the charging instructions as this unit uses a NiMh battery, not a Lithium one and they are prone to battery memory. Do as the instructions say and charge it fully before using, about 10 hours, then unplug it and let it sit in the provided cradle. Make sure to run the batteries completely out before recharging for another 10 hours and never leave it on the charger for days on end if you care to have it work for years to come.

The trimmer on my face shaver is far, far better. All in all, it has some value, but it's not what the reviews had led me to expect.

I have only charged this item 2x in the last 5 days which was amazing compared to the 2020 which after a shaving session, I would have to charge daily. Buy this bodygroom and I highly recommend setting up with the Subscription of replacement blades at least every 6 months but more like every 4 months if you are using frequently because the blades do wear out fast. No cons so far, this seems to be better built then the 2020 *my second one split, the rubber button split from body*.. Well worth it to me.
