  1428. My complaint with other personal groomers from Braun and Remington that I've used is that they sometimes pull rather than cut hair. While that's not a huge problem when trimming facial hair or the hair on your head, it's a dicey situation when trimming in the more \\"sensitive\\" areas.<br /><br />The Norelco, however, does a great job. Cuts quickly and zero pulling. I mostly use the hair trimming side (the end that has the adjustable length guide) since I only want to keep things tidy rather than go for the full bald effect. It's gentle even when using it without the length guide.<br /><br />I also like that it has independent switches for either end, and that the charging stand is easy to use. There's no need to switch heads or use attachments since everything is built-in. That keeps the counter clutter down. Plus, it looks nice, and has a very solid feel.<br /><br />If you need to trim in the nether regions, and want to make sure you the process is pain-free, this is the best one out there that I've tried. Highly recommend.

You have to hold it PERPENDICULAR to the area you're cutting at all times and let the \\"edge trimmers\\" pivot on to your skin. The second the shaver over a 45 degree angle to your skin, you will cut yourself.<br /><br />Pros:<br />- It does shave your sausage and meatballs pretty close, pretty DAMN close.<br /><br />- It's waterproof so you can use it in the shower, though I suggest you don't cause it works best on dry hair.<br /><br />- The beard attachment is well designed, no extra attachments, it's all on there with a click per hair length.<br /><br />- The warranty is AMAZING.   1443. Pretty good shaver, seems to be as sharp as ever, doesn't tug on my hair or anything like that. I have used it a few times a week for almost 2 years. The outside prong on guard for the clipper side snapped off, I will have to get another one from the mfr. at some point... for $15!!!! I wish the clipper head was a little bigger like the shaver side, it takes a while to do larger surfaces, like my BALLS :) It's nice that it can be rinsed out, because when tiny little hair dust gets in the trimmer, it slows down a bit and seems like it needs a charge, when it actually just needs a cleaning. The detent on the lengths on the clipper side is a little sloppy, it seems to just rely on the tension of some flimsy plastic, and has dropped from a 2 to a 1 mid-shave a couple times (but I'm a little heavy-handed). If you push down while shaving, it will move the guard, so be careful. You can hold the guard in place pretty easily so it doesn't move if you are nervous about that. I go with a 1 on the face these days, so there is no threat of it going lower for me. The way the charger works is pretty nice, but you have to make sure the light goes on, there isn't a positive click or anything when you rest it on the cradle. After reading a few articles and looking at the competition today (I was thinking of upgrading) I have decided to stick with this trimmer for now, it is as good an option you can find out there at this price. Remember: ladies don't want you all hairy down there, more than you want THEM all hairy down there!
  1444. Disclaimer: My rating for the Norelco bodygroom is based on my experience with it. I am not representative of all people so please take my negative review with a grain of salt. The Norelco did not work for me, therefore, I cannot rate it highly. That is not a reflection on it's build quality.<br /><br />I purchased the bodygroom to enter the world of being hairless just to see what it was like. I've been doing weigh training and high intensity interval cardio for quite some time. Naturally, I wanted to show off the new physique. I mean can you honestly blame me? I have very sensitive skin so I figured a regular razor was out so, after seeing the high reviews on the norelco bodygroom I thought hey, maybe this would work! Nope. Not for me. Hindsight being 20/20 I should have known better but nothing ventured nothign gained right?<br /><br />Now first off, the Norelco Bodygroom is a very, very well made piece of equipment. It's solid and durable, not to mention waterproof! None of the parts wobble or are loose. The unit features two ends, a basic trimmer akin to a hairclipper with multiple settings. The trimmer guard is attached to the unit with a little \\"push lever\\" that slides up and clicks in place to get the setting you want. I never used the trimmer, but this strikes me as odd as if you push too hard when actually trimming wouldn't it click back down? Perhaps it's not the case for most due to the number of high reviews but the thought crossed my mind. The trimmer was a little loud when I switched in on just to see but it didn't bother me in the slightest. It's a motor. It's going to make noise.<br /><br />On the other end is the shaver which has two low-powered trimmers on either end, so you can cut your hair down to a short length before it gets shaved. The shaver worked rather well (at cutting hair), and this is the key, in flat areas. From my experience, the shaver wasn't entirely consistent. On some areas of my chest and stomach, it chopped the hairs off no issue; smooth as glass. There are some areas though that this thing just wouldn't shave. A particulary troublesome area was the bony center in between one's pectorals. The head is too big to maneuver in there. I tried multiple angles but couldn't get it. It also just wouldn't be consistent right on my pectorals and I could feel hairs longer than the others that it just wouldn't want to grab. Now I know that electric razors in of themselves aren't perfect, but even if it didn't cut FULLY I would at least expect a consistent cut if that makes sense. I could probably blame some of the inconsistency on the fact that I am one hairy dude; I'd say my hair is pretty thick too so honestly it wouldn't surprise me if the trimmer just couldn't handle my type of body hair. Once I was done I knew that the recovery was going to be a nightmare. As I'm typing this I still have razorburn all over my front. It's been awful.<br /><br />Beyond this I can't review the item any more than my preliminary experience. I ordered this through Target and I immediately returned it the next morning. This review is not to say this might not work for those with much thinner, or much less body hair. In fact it'd probably be a wonder tool for you. For those of us who are very hairy, I'd recommend just doing some manscaping with clippers with a short guard or no guard with maximum taper. Save yourself the suffering of it growing back, especially if you have sensitive skin; this thing will give you razorburn like you've never had before.<br /><br />To sum it up I cannot give this more than two stars beacuse of my bad experience. Again, I am sure it would work for many but it's simply not for me. I will stick with my good ol' Wahl Chrome Pro clippers and just trim it all!sue; smooth as glass. There are some areas though that this thing just wouldn't shave. A particulary troublesome area was the bony center in between one's pectorals. The head is too big to maneuver in there. I tried multiple angles but couldn't get it. It also just wouldn't be consistent right on my pectorals and I could feel hairs longer than the others that it just wouldn't want to grab. Now I know that electric razors in of themselves aren't perfect, but even if it didn't cut FULLY I would at least expect a consistent cut if that makes sense. I could probably blame some of the inconsistency on the fact that I am one hairy dude; I'd say my hair is pretty thick too so honestly it wouldn't surprise me if the trimmer just couldn't handle my type of body hair. Once I was done I knew that the recovery was going to be a nightmare. As I'm typing this I still have razorburn all over my front. It's been awful.<br /><br />Beyond this I can't review the item any more than my preliminary experience. I ordered this through Target and I immediately returned it the next morning. This review is not to say this might not work for those with much thinner, or much less body hair. In fact it'd probably be a wonder tool for you. For those of us who are very hairy, I'd recommend just doing some manscaping with clippers with a short guard or no guard with maximum taper. Save yourself the suffering of it growing back, especially if you have sensitive skin; this thing will give you razorburn like you've never had before.<br /><br />To sum it up I cannot give this more than two stars beacuse of my bad experience. Secondly, the light is useless, it only lights up when the battery has approximately 10 minutes of power in it, it doesn't light up when you put it in the charging dock so you know if it is charging or not, it lights up when the battery is full but then it goes off after 30 minutes. Lastly and the most annoying thing for me is that you have to charge via the charging dock, you can't plug the power supply directly to the trimmer, which is annoying.

These batteries held up long enough for me to use it one full session before recharging when it was new. After a year or two they faded out

  1502. It's not perfect, but I haven't found anything better yet. I've had this for almost 3 years and just started having battery problems. The battery problems were typical for 3 year old (cheap) rechargeable batteries. It would hold a charge just long enough for about a single use and then need to be placed back on the charger. Not terribly inconvenient, but I knew it was just a matter of time before that wouldn't work. I came back to Amazon to order a replacement and see what other models might be available, but I would have been fine ordering this model again given it's performance. In the questions area there is a tip on replacing the cheap rechargeable batteries with 2 AAA batteries. I used the white Amazon basics and I'm back in business. My guess is these quality batteries will last much longer than 3 years.<br /><br />Pro-tip: For delicate areas, take your time. Work in layers if you're working with long hair. Thinking of mowing the grass, if it were too long you wouldn't put the mower on the lowest setting. After continued use, you'll see 2 changes. One, you will get better at finding a technique that works for you. Second, your skin will change and be less sensitive to the trimmer.

The worst part is the way it was designed the battery compartment on the inside within the razor is specifically designed to be too small to fit your standard AAA batteries. Meaning you can not fix the dead batteries on your own. In essence by design this device has a short lifespan and there is nothing you can do to fix it. They intentionally crested defects likely for the purpose of getting you to buy a new one. Alright so I got this guy here. Came already set up. The battery may or may not have any power in it when you get it so I would suggest charging right away. Removes any disappointment. To the product. Parts remove easily for cleaning and it does exactly as it's supposed to. Can be used for shaving almost any area. Two stars for the shaver side. The battery lasts forever it seems, and the device is easy to clean. The charging stand is aesthetically pleasing on the counter top which is kind of a nice unexpected bonus. Overall: I had hoped for a shaver that did it all in one gadget. Due to the rough shave of a single cutter head, this one isn't it. That said, the beard trimmer does such a nice job it's worth ignoring the top side of the shaver if that's all you're after!

I like a stubbled look and this cuts down to almost clean shaven (yet not fully clean shaven for those of you hoping for that) so it really just left me with an ungroomed lazy look. The adjustable side is much better but with no guard on it has trouble powering through my rather thick facial hair. For the price this thing is worth it and all things considered I like it better than the last shaver I had but I could certainly see room for improvement. I'd buy this razor again, but not before looking around at my other options for something better.

  1561. I've been using this trimmer for a couple years now. It's solid and reliable and even my wife has started using it for some of her grooming needs. The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars from me is the battery is a bit temperamental. Don't make the mistake of leaving it on the charger when not in use, the battery seems to form a memory and will start to lose power near the end of grooming. I was able to correct this to a small extent by repeatedly turning on the unit and leaving it running until it stopped on it's own and not returning it to the charger until it wouldn't turn on again. An auto shut off feature for charging would have been the perfect compliment to this product.

  1584. I was looking at myself in a mirror one evening, and it finally truly occurred to me that having neglected shaving my nether regions for 24 years, it was really rather nasty and unruly down there. So I started looking at my options, and initially I was terrified to make an attempt - horror stories of badly conducted traditional shaving methods and waxing are abundant online. Even in the stories that result in a non-mutilated and less hairy ending, complaints of excessive itchiness for days to weeks are present.<br /><br />However I came across the BG2040 on Amazon, and after seeing the glowing reviews for it took the plunge and purchased it (Not from Amazon, I found a better deal locally) The unit comes with a charging stand and small cleaning brush to help clean out any excess hair that gets stuck within it. When you initially purchase it, you're supposed to let the groomer charge for a full hour before using it. Since it was late at night, I opted to simply let it charge overnight. The next morning I grabbed the groomer, put on my game face, and took the plunge starting to use it.<br /><br />If you're like me and have/had never shaved before down there, you will notice that initially you'll experience a few split seconds of mild pain as all the hair gets pulled around. It's nothing worse than getting pricked by a toothpick or something equivalent though. After the first few seconds this feeling resided and to my delight hair was just falling off like mad into the toilet below me. Obviously you can't go zooming with this thing at mach speeds, but the trimmer end (the flat pivoting head) is really great at simply contorting to your shape, and it smoothly shaves around any object you put in it's path without damaging anything.<br /><br />In the end it took me about 5-10 minutes to finish. The groomer is easy to clean, you just pop off the head and rinse it off with water. I have since used this on 2 other occasions to equally good success. At no point have I experienced any more itching than is typical when unshaven. I've tried the device in both a dry environment and in the shower. While it works in both environments, I prefer using it dry - as it's easier to see how you're progressing without all your hair being drenched and clinging to your body.<br /><br />I would highly recommend this groomer to anyone who would like to take care of themselves in a typically inhospitable region to ordinary hygienic devices.e I experienced any more itching than is typical when unshaven. Comes with a small brush to clean off the hair, and it's easily detachable to clean with water.<br /><br />This really is a perfect shaver - I spent 60 bucks on my first electric shaver because I trusted people buying this from Amazon, so hopefully you can trust my two thumbs up here too.

  1595. I upgraded to this model of the BodyGroom after having owned the three prior generations of this device. It has grown in size now, due to the two separate ends for shaving/trimming versus clipping. Prior iterations of the BodyGroom had a detachable head that you could swap out for clipping versus shaving/trimming, and detachable combs to fit onto the clipper to control the length of clipping. This newest model has it all self contained on one handle (opposite ends), with no separate heads or combs to attach or lose.<br /><br />The shaving/trimming head is improved compared to the prior version, as the head is now articulated (it swings forward and back) to better match the contour of your body. For those of you that are apprehensive about using this device in sensitive areas - don't be. If you go slowly, and are careful to pull the skin taut ahead of where you are shaving, then there are no nicks, period. The shaver/trimmer end works well at removing hair while not risking injury to your sensitive parts, a phenomenon that I could never fully avoid despite how careful I was when using a razor with a blade.<br /><br />The clipping end has a self-contained comb that adjusts via a sliding-locking button to control the length of clipping. It clips body hair smoothly without pulling. The self-contained comb works well and is a vast improvement over separate combs for each length on prior versions of this device that could easily be lost or broken when snapping them on and off.<br /><br />The charging stand works well for the 1 hour it takes to charge it, and it folds away flat for easy storage.<br /><br />Highly recommend the BodyGroom Pro! Fearless body hair grooming, including sensitive areas.

  1643. If you're like me, you'll use this trimmer a couple times a month. I use it to trim my sideburns, neckline, chest hair, and hair below the belt. It really does a good job doing that. The only problem I have with it is that it can't hold a charge, and it takes FOREVER to charge it in the first place. Which wouldn't be a problem if you kept it plugged in all the time, but I don't have the counter space or the need to waste electric. What normally happens is I forget to plug it in until it's too late. A 20 minute charge will get you about a minute of shaving time, and when you're trimming all over, that's just not enough time. So, that's why I gave it three stars instead of five...the crappy battery. I also never use the &#34;shaving&#34; end, only the adjustable trimming end. If they would replace the shaving end with a cord...that would be my ideal trimmer.
  1644. To be clear, I have only used this product four times at this time of this writing. I have, however, garnered a good sense of it's capabilities and drawbacks. First, this is the best grooming product I have used to-date. This thing has the capabilities to power through dense hair growth without the need to constantly clean out a razor blade, and has the added benefit of not irritating my skin. The head is a typical electric razor head with shears on either side. This allows for with or against-the-grain shaving that generally clears all of the hair in one pass, and without the need to use two different tools to get the job done. Like any electric razor, you are not going to get a razor-blade close shave, but the difference is negligible unless you absolutely need to be baby smooth. I have not had the misfortune of running out the battery at this point, so I can't speak to it's longevity; however, you have nothing to worry about even if you shave your entire body in one session with this device.<br /><br />Now that I've raved about the product, allow me issue a warning to those who, like me, groom their groin area. As I previously stated, this has a standard electric razor head with shears on either side. This means that it is fantastic for smooth skin, but not for wrinkled skin. It is safe to use on the pelvic area, upper thighs, and the crease of your thighs. It is not however safe to use on either your scrotum or shaft. Any experienced man-scaper is familiar with the erect and stretch methodology of shaving this sensitive area, but this product is not even safe to be used with that method. While I didn't incur any serious injury, I was cut several times while attempting to use this device. For those wishing to shave these particular areas, you're going to want to stick with the razor blade or standard electric razor head. Admittedly, I glanced over the manual, so it might issue a similar warning that I missed. In either case, you have been warned.

  1667. I had been using my Norelco 3 rotating head shaver all over and it worked well, but I decided I wanted to try something made for below the neck. Far below the neck. I had tried the Body Bare shaver, but it is only effective as an after-the-shave shaver and managed to nick me. I have to admit I was a little concerned about buying this groomer, given some of the reviewers complaints abou the edge blades. Those reviews made it sound as if one would be taking an electric hacksaw to his nether regions. But, since the good reviews far outweighed the bad ones, I decided to go ahead. I'm glad I did. It does a very good job for an electric. No electric will shave as close as a manual razor, so if that's what you're expecting, don't bother. Having said that, it gives a very close shave. No ingrowns, no itching. Compared to the 3 head Norelco I have been using, it does give a somewhat closer shave. But, if you already have a 3 head Norelco, I can't say this is worth getting, unless you don't like the idea of using your face shaver elsewhere. Back to the BodyGroom: It does an admirable job of shaving smoothly and closely everywhere in the nether regions, without nicks or other drama. About those side cutters --- I don't see how people are getting cut by them. It's not like they are a set of exposed teeth. Even when not placing the shaver properly, it didn't give the slightest pull or nick. I also like that both the shaver and trimmer can be cleaned by washing them off. The charger stand is a bit gimmicky, but works fine. Quite a few of the negative reviews referred to very short battery life. Unlikely as it is, I wonder if those people perhaps didn't read the instructions? One thing a little unusual is that the instructions state that the shaver should NOT be charged after each use. Rather, the battery should be allowed to run down almost completely before recharging. The problem with that is the charger also serves as a cradle for the shaver. It is therefore tempting and logical to want to put the shaver in the cradle when done with it. Of course, one can unplug it and use the cradle that way. Since most such electronic devices suggest only perodic run-downs, it's a bit of an annoyance. Having said all this, I have only had the unit a few days, so I can't comment further on the battery life. To summarize, if you are looking for a body groomer that shaves very close, is forgiving of its use, doesn't cut, pull or irritate your skin, this is a good one. If you are looking for a wax job, you won't get it.ore tempting and logical to want to put the shaver in the cradle when done with it. Of course, one can unplug it and use the cradle that way. Since most such electronic devices suggest only perodic run-downs, it's a bit of an annoyance. Having said all this, I have only had the unit a few days, so I can't comment further on the battery life. To summarize, if you are looking for a body groomer that shaves very close, is forgiving of its use, doesn't cut, pull or irritate your skin, this is a good one. If you are looking for a wax job, you won't get it.

  1731. I was hesitant to buy this because a past reviewer stated that it pulled hair instead it was shaving. I decided to go through with the purchase because I could return it if I wasn't satisfied. I went to use it and it did indeed pull my hair, so I was a bit annoyed that this reviewer was correct. The machine was on and the hair was painfully coming off my body. However, upon closer inspection I realized that I, stupidly, pressed the wrong button.<br />There are 2 ends to this piece and the button closest to the end that you want to use should be pushed to activate the blades. This is obvious! I have just never encountered a razor with 2 ends before, hence my terrible rookie mistake. Once I pressed the button and tried again my life has never been the same. This thing cuts hair, all the hair, perfectly. No rash, no pain, no itching, just smooth, hairless areas. This should be a &#34;must have&#34; for every single guy. Don't hesitate to purchase this thing, it is well worth the money

This is a little disappointing as my hope was to use this product as my sole groomer, but it has definitely made regular maintenance quicker, easier and something that I stay on top of.<br /><br />The groomer itself is comfortable to hold and use, and the shaving head can be used moving in either direction. Battery life is decent, I usually go a couple days between charges. You can definitely tell when the charge is getting low because it will start to pull hairs.<br /><br />Overall a good product. I would recommend buying to help keep up with day to day needs, but keep in mind you will likely need to supplement with something else if you want a smooth, irritation free finish.

I'm following instructions and will charge this when it gets low on battery life. The instructions also show how to remove the batteries and replace them if it stops holding a charge.<br /><br />Good stuff. Get the most expensive model. That's the one you want.

  1832. It is a pattern with Norelco rechargeable shavers, that you can't use them while they are plugged into an outlet. Sometimes you just want to dedicate extra time and get a detailed shave. If you run out of juice mid shave with this shaver, you will have to wait 30 minutes to an hour to get enough charge for the rest of the job. That is very inconvenient. The one plus for this shaver is that it has a strong battery which lasts longer and trims hard till it discharges.<br /><br />The shave itself is decent. You have to be careful with the close shave head b/c it tends to nick skin. The trimmer portion is good, and its nice that it is adjustable so you don't need different attachment lengths floating around your bathroom.<br /><br />3/5, could be better.
  1833. Nice that is is waterproof, so trimming in the shower is fine. Never used the shaver side, just the trimmer. It works fine. But the battery is horrendous. I took three stars out because I had to throw the shaver away. I tried replacing the battery but it's very difficult. Opening the unit is ok, but may break the waterproofing. The problem is in the battery itself. It's two cells soldered together. Using a AA instead is hard because the originals don't have the raised terminal (nub) and you need to somehow connect two of them together. Maybe if you solder. I couldn't do it.<br /><br />Now I need a new one and I will not buy this again. I would if the battery had been upgraded.

  1868. I bought this Philips Norelco for self-grooming (I'm loathe to use the term &#34;manscaping&#34;) and have found it to be superbly designed. Here's a rundown of what stood out to me:<br /><br />Size/Shape<br />This is probably my favorite thing about it. The length of it is just long enough to use as a wand of sorts, and the slight curve allows you to angle the trimmer edge on the shaver head to get your back and shoulders or other hard to reach places at a right angle.<br /><br />Battery/Charger<br />I like the folding base used to recharge the groomer. You would think that when you pop the unit into the base it would slide or fall out, but it grips it firmly and the indicator light lets you know it's charging/finished charging. The battery lasts quite a while (I'd say over an hour to even two hours of solid use) and I have to recharge it after maybe every 4th time I use it. There's an independent power button for each of the two heads.<br /><br />Use/Comfort<br />Most trimmers will pinch you when you're working in tender areas. I have used it on the MOST tender of areas, and I think you have to be pretty reckless to receive a nip from this one, regardless of which end you are working with. However, I do think using the clipper edge with the guard removed is by far the riskiest proposition. I advise against that unless it's in a flat spot with tougher/taught skin. Finally, I like that it's water-resistant (I have used it in the shower to no ill-effect). I like the adjustable guard--it feels a little flimsy but is quick, easy and stable. Cleaning is easy--both ends either pop open or pop off to be brushed or blown out with canned air.<br /><br />I definitely recommend this to men or as a gift to a man.

  1870. really pulls hair when you shave, I don't know if i got a botch one but....<br /><br />The trimmer is useful

Unfortunately, the same is not true for the trimmer when it comes to the testicles - you will get nicks and they will hurt. I had much better luck with a $12 trimmer from Walmart, followed by shaving with a blade. The the trimmer side does work really well as an eyebrow trimmer. Ran it in every direction with the guard on, shortest setting (position 1). It gets rid of bushiness and leaves the area above your eyes well groomed and masculine-looking ... without giving you the appearance of waxing/tweezing your brows.

  1922. I've owned a number of trimmers of various types in the past and used and/or misused them in probably every way possible. My last one (a beard trimmer) stopped charging after a few years of occasional use, probably because it had cheap NiCad batteries in it. I decided to get something actually made for multi-use and that was claimed to have better a better battery-type that also hopefully didn't take hours to charge. Based on a few other postive ratings, I grabbed this unit.<br /><br />I've only used this a few times now, but so far, I'm impressed:<br /><br />Pros--<br />-It charges in hour or less<br />-It seems to have a much stronger/faster set of motors than any other I've used<br />-It has a separate trimmer end/motor from the close-cut shaver end/motor<br />-No futzing around with various attachment types just to do different cuts of different lengths or different places<br />-sharp and makes quick work of most all types of hair<br />-didn't pinch, cut, scrape, or otherwise hurt me, even when I used it on the most tender parts, and I even used the shaver end it on everything down yonder! (And yes, I'm a guy, so that could have been messy and traumatic).<br />-With minimal effort, it really did shave closer than any other trimmer/shaver I've ever used. A blade would be closer, but that's about it.<br /><br />Cons--<br />-A tad more expensive than I would have liked; I'll forgive that if it continues to perform for a few years at least<br />-Unusual/proprietary charging &#34;rack&#34;. It actually makes sense once I understood the design to be waterproof and hence not have holes for a plug on the unit itself. It's just that it initially confused me (no, I didn't RTFM) and I wondered if there's any way for that design to go flaky with such minimal contact points.<br /><br />Beyond cleaning it under tap water, I haven't tested the waterproofness of this, although I understand that might be a significant factor for some.

  1932. This is a really great shaver/groomer. It's virtually impossible to nick or cut yourself with it (although it did happen once with me), so it's ideal for guys who might be a little careless when it comes to trimming. The plastic attachment for the trimmer end works great and you can change it up and down depending on how long or short you want to keep or cut hair. I find that sometimes even the shortest setting might not be short enough...but that's where the shaver end comes into play. It can be a little difficult to shave some parts, but overall it does a good job of what it advertises. Plus you can use it in the shower. The only &#34;bad&#34; part about it is that it's a hassle to clean...hair gets almost all over this product if you use it like I do, and if you want to maintain it you have to take it apart and make sure all the hair is out. But that's not a huge deal. Another thing that can be annoying is the charging dock. Sometimes the unit does not like to stay in the dock properly so it ends up not charging. Be sure the light is lit up and stays lit so it charges. The metal contacts on the plastic dock and the unit don't like to stay touching properly all the time!
  1933. I purchased this to replace an older model of the BodyGroom. It is perfect for removing hair from where i don't want it. I take it to the gym and use it in the shower there. My only complaint is there is no wrist strap attachment so you can't easily drop it to the floor when showering and your hands are wet and soapy, which the older model had.
  1934. I got this as a replacement for my 4 year old plain norelco body groom. However I am going back to what I have been using since the body groom pro is not smooth at all!<br /><br />The rolling capability of the foil shaving head makes the cutters drag on your skin as you run the foil shaver across your body. Also the cutters don't cut very well since the plastic mechanism which the cutters/foil shaver sit it to allow it to roll ends up getting in the way of cutting hair since it rolls unnecessarily into your skin.<br /><br />Whoever designed this stupid &#34;roll&#34; functionality so it follows the contours of your body, must have never used it on himself. I'll go back to the basic model or another brand
  1935. It's two, two, two clippers in one! Having two layers of trimming power really makes this product worthwhile. I highly recommend!
  1936. The battery in this product is HORRIBLE. It has been charging for past 5 hours and when I start using it it runs out in like 10 minutes. absolutely useless. Could've been better if battery lasted longer or it was possible to plug it in and use it.
  1937. Makes manscaping soooo much easier especially in the lower areas which you need the most concentration..:) And its double ended to make the groomer an all in one which takes up less space.
  1938. when i purchased this thing... i figured it would be like all the other razors... its seriously the best ive ever used... not cuts and no burns and i can use it anywhere. get it.
  1939. Best body groomer/shaver for the money. Such a close buzz, on all body parts!

  1941. better than any razor on the market. Easy to use, do not use shaving foam. Works amazingly well. buyi. you will never use anyhting else

  1943. I thought with all the positive reviews this would be a good shaver for a man but it is definitely not. I have been mangled. That's the only way I can describe it. Even with holding the skin of my scrotum tight, this shaver ended up snagging my skin and ripping my skin causing bleeding. I had tried it once before and it pinched me and caused a minor bleeding incident. This was two tries and now I am tossing it. The blades are unprotected and touch directly on your skin. That's scary and terrible. I have no idea how this shaver got on the market.
  1944. Great product, i love it
  1945. I was skeptical about getting this for man-scaping but after my first use I am amazed by this product. The dual buzzers by the shaver help to make it more comfortable and easy because it cuts longer hairs down and then has the shaver right there to shave it clean. I also loved how you don't only have to go in one direction because the head pivots which allows you to go back and forth until the forest is gone.<br /><br />I will give one tip though, on the more sensitive areas I would say be careful and go slow if you are using the shaver side, if you go too fast ya might nick yourself a bit but I did notice that going slower eliminates that.<br /><br />I also am one to be known to have sensitive skin and I have yet to have a problem on my upper legs and my inner elbows which is where I usually break out if I use a normal electric shaver or a razor and shaving cream.<br /><br />All in all I love this product and I recommend this over having to go get waxed etc.
